meanings.definition: To eat a snack or light meal
meanings.sent1: After school, she noshed on some crackers.
meanings.sent2: He often noshed on fruit between meals.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel noshed on the nuts like it was at a buffet.
meanings.sent4: The kids noshed on knowledge during the educational game.
meanings.sent5: The birds noshed on the breadcrumbs, chirping happily.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she noshed on a sandwich for lunch.
meanings.sent2: He noshed on some chips while watching TV last night.
meanings.sent3: The cat noshed on the fish so quickly, it seemed like magic.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the delicious meal noshed at his mind all day.
meanings.sent5: The idea noshed at her until she finally understood it.
